comments.commentBody: Ryan MUST have been compromised. Remember his wistful longing to be at home with his family on weekends? Washington, DC must be a lonely place for a young man, and there are plenty of nefarious operatives out to snare the careless.

Nothing has changed, whenever he feels that he is losing control, he comes up with another birther alternate fact.

When would this nightmare end?

What did we do to deserve this?

Probably because Democrats cheated Bernie out of nomination.

No, he is not "suffering" from any disorder.  The only way he will be suffering is when he has low ratings and cannot rationalize why that has happened. If he has any disorder he will not get any treatment for it, as long as he continues to have a significant following.

It is now painfully clear that the man in the Oval Office is dangerously unqualified.  This is a level of delusion and paranoia exceeding my memories of Nixon during Watergate.  Let us keep up the pressure on Congress to remove him before he inflicts irreparable damage on our country.
Everyday I think he can't do anything stupider and then I wake up and once again he has surprised me. How long can this funny man keep this up

With a presidential candidate gushing about what a great leader Putin is, and how we should be friends with a leader who murders his opposition, and asking Russia to hack his opponent to get him into the white house, it would be irresponsible NOT to tap his phones.

Certain maladies could produce brazen con men who would eventually be found out.

In psychological parlance, the term "folie a deux" explains shared paranoia, the kind that could occur in a close relationship--as in husband and wife. But this shared malady, among republicans, would need a number far greater than "deux."
If only this weren't real life - the story lines his twisted mind is coming up with would make a great soap opera.
Do you mean like how Obama blamed Bush for his poor economic performance for the entire 8 years of his presidency?
It's 25th Amendment time.

As many claims are?
Or as many people are doing?

As a fundamental point, Obama had no authority to order anything even closely approaching a wiretap. The DOJ, however, does have such authority. So casting aside for the moment the very legitimate question of whether Trump's allegations are at all based in a reality more tangible than whatever space Mark Levin and Breitbart exist in, if there has been any tapping of his phones or other means of communication, it could only come at the end of a court ordered warrant. And for such a writ to be issued there has to exist probable cause for the judge to conclude that a crime has been committed.

And though the actual truth is closer to Trump simply having invented this mess as a means of diverting attention away from all this attention the meetings between his camp and Kislyak is garnering, if the allegations are true, we must assume that this is his feeble attempt to get out in front of, or establish the early narrative for, a story that is much more damaging to his interests.

Either way, we have a very large problem here. The man is either on the eventual end of a much deeper investigation into his campaign's contacts with Russian agents/officials or--and this may ultimately prove to be more problematic--he is completely willing to accept as fact any and every hair-brained conspiracy theory than comes to his attention. What decisions are made with that sort of mindset ought to scare anyone--even his most ardent supporters.
Can't believe we are having this conversation!

"Makes sense that" is not the same "did." Given the life insurance policy, it makes sense that my wife would have me murdered, but before making the accusation, a little evidence is needed, say, my body. Moreover, given that Obama was not going to be president on Janurary 21 regardless of the outcome of the election, the assertion "everything to lose" is over the top.

If it turns out that a warrant _was_ issued, then the FISA court believed that there was probable cause for the search. Thus, the the FBI was working under authority of law, not just of the executive branch. (Assuming, of course, that there was a wiretap and that the president's twittered assertions aren't just fantasies from the fever swamp.)

And it will probably work. Indeed, a more accurate headline would likely read, "Trump supporters accept latest set of wild, unfounded accusations without question; decry 'fake news' about administration officials' contacts with Russia."

Never underestimate the gullibility of the American voter. After years of Rush Limbaugh, Ann Coulter, Fox News, Donald Trump and the scare tactics of the GOP, some Americans seem ready to believe anything about the "evil" liberals and the "horrors" facing our country.

Our only hope is the uprising of activism & engagement brought on by Trump's win. And perhaps the restoration of the "Fairness Doctrine" to bring back more allegiance to the truth in broadcasting.
Please let CIA Or FBI, whatever the intelligence agency to verify the claim first before we speak.

Come on, somebody leak them tax returns and put an end to this.  To think that somewhere inside the IRS there is a group of people who actually know what is in those returns and they are watching this - thinking what?  Either there is nothing there and they are laughing at us.  Or there is something really bad, and they are sitting on it, because everybody would know who leaked the documents, given that this group is likely to be small.  There is no way of knowing, of course, but I think that the returns might show bribes from Russians masked as business transactions.  Maybe not even "hard bribes" in return for action but something to give the president a good impression of Russia, overpaying for property and so on.
Anyone wonder how Trump knows what he says he knows and how Trump’s loyal follower know that he knows it?
Trump is becoming completely unhinged.
He will say or do anything to avoid facing up to his deficiencies as a person or as a president.
Proof that the Republican party has no principles and its leadership has no spine.
This seems to be his "I'm not a crook" moment.
Really, it isn't that shocking. But it is appalling and embarrassing.

I would like to point out that "conservative radio hosts" are sure doing a very poor job of running our nation, but an excellent job of ruining our nation. And while I'm at it, apart from a strong touch of lunacy, what does it take to be a "conservative radio host?"
